intro: Conomorpha peruviana var. guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana variant of the Peruvian conomorpha, is a shrub native to tropical South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
